result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah J. FERRERI was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Schedule II Non-Narcotics (Buprenorphine) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).
  • Deliver Schedule II Narcotics (Morphine) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to the prison sentence presently being served on count 3 of this case to commence upon defendant's discharge date after extended supervision ends.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the
Department's assessment process.

No contact with any bars or liquor stores.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

The defendant has successfully completed the Earned Release Program as of 02-24-17.
Cover letter.
Adding $800.00 restitution as a condition of extended supervision, payable to Christopher Walters.

Stipulation and Order to Amend Conditions of Extended Supervision.
It is hereby ordered that the judgment of conviction in this case be amended to include restitution in the amount of $800.00 to Christopher Walters, 908 Raton Court, Manitowoc, WI as a condition of extended supervision.  As agreed by the parties, case no: 15 CF 152 is dismissed.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody on WRIT.  
Count 1 - Deliver Schedule II Non-Narcotic, 2nd & subsequent offense (Buprenorphine) - No contest plea. 
Count 3 - Deliver Schedule II Narcotic, 2nd & subsequent offense (Morphine) - No contest plea.
Count 4 - Bail Jumping - No contest plea.  Convicted.  State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2,5,6,7,8, and 9.  Motion granted.   State further reads in an uncharged incident No. 13-15786 from the City of Manitowoc.                                    Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.   Report to be filed by 05-29-15.  Sentencing hearing is set for 06-15-15 at 9:00 a.m.   
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.  
$50.00 cash bail from 14 CF 281 applied on this case. 
Minutes.

Copy filed.
Plea date set for 03-26-15 at 1:30 .m.

Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 02-20-15 at 1:45 p.m.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.

Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.

Preliminary hearing is reset to 12-02-14 at 3:00 p.m.
Minutes.
Cover letter.
Eric Pangburn, through public defender.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 11-05-14 at 2:15 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours.  Bail furnished.
